intro: Anemone demissa var. chrysauges, commonly known as the golden anemone, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 10–15 inches, featuring a basal rosette of hairy, lobed leaves. The plant produces clusters of showy, yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for woodland gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate appearance and ability to naturalize in suitable conditions.
